Posts.Content: Hi Keza1,  Sorry you haven't had a response yet I'm just popping to see if your alright, I can't help with your question but just wanted to check if your still worried about it, and if you found an answer.
Posts.Title: Spacer making breast swollen

Posts.Content: Hi Collies, if you can ( or want to) it helps to complete your profile so we can help you better with questions, we have had someone who has had melanoma that had spread to their breast, and I had melanoma that spread to my ovary. So good that you clarified to Kacang, you might want to click on the + sign to leave the melanoma group it’s just under the big heading.  Good luck with your op.
Posts.Title: LYMPH NODES BEING REMOVED SOON

Posts.Content: Hi Plattmom, that’s a very interesting question (I had a scan today, every 3 months over the last 2 years). You could copy your question into Ask a nurse in the ask an expert section, if there is a better expert to ask they will just move the question or consult.
Posts.Title: How do they track and measure radiation?

Posts.Content: Hello Tansi, sorry about your despondency, I hope things pick up soon, and I’m hoping as your post is at the top at the moment some others will be a long to give you some input.  I haven’t had surgery but I’ve had immunotherapy which has worked really well for, currently clear scans, next scan due 10 th of Jan.  good luck for you Mums radiotherapy.
Posts.Title: Mum CT shows chest nodes effected

Posts.Content: Hello Tansi, welcome to the online community, I’m sorry to hear about your Mum. I noticed that you hadn’t had a reply yet and so thought I’d pop in from the melanoma group to say hi. I was wondering if your question would be partly answered although not by personal experience, by this information Breast cancer info link it also gives the help line number if you want further info or just chat about what you are going through as a concerned relative. There are also a range of booklets about different cancers in the Publications and resources section I know you mentioned you were a nurse and wanting to research more about your Mums illness, so you may have already found these booklets that can be downloaded from the site.  I am a melanoma patient that had an unknown primary that spread to my abdominal and pelvic lymph nodes and then to my ovary.  I must say though that sometimes it is best to take one step at a time to expect the best until proven otherwise. There are too many what ifs sometimes that might not happen and can be scary. It may be of course that you feel in control having more info and getting yourself prepared and that a talk to the helpline 0808 808 0000 May be good for you it’s open Monday to Friday 9am to 8pm.  Wishing you and your mum the best.
Posts.Title: Mum CT shows chest nodes effected

Posts.Content: Hi puzzler you are not so much of a Luddite, as if you click on your profile name on the left above, it will take you to your profile where you can click on your friends. You will see in your list of friends that Carolyn28 is there. You've done it congrats.  Best wishes to all.
